capabilities.name: Plan and Prioritise
capabilities.description: Developing and supporting the implementation of flood risk management programs requires advanced planning and prioritization skills to address complex challenges.

capabilities.name: Think and Solve Problems
capabilities.description: Requires advanced problem-solving skills to understand and manage complex flooding processes and develop practical solutions for flood risk management.

capabilities.name: Demonstrate Accountability
capabilities.description: Responsible for delivering projects within the scope of relevant policy, guidance, and legislation, demonstrating a high level of accountability.

capabilities.name: Communicate Effectively
capabilities.description: Must excel at building strong relationships with stakeholders and providing expert advice, necessitating advanced communication skills.

capabilities.name: Work Collaboratively
capabilities.description: Thrives in collaborative, multidisciplinary environments, indicating a need for advanced collaboration skills.

capabilities.name: Project Management
capabilities.description: Extensive experience in delivering projects to support flood risk management indicates a need for advanced project management skills.

capabilities.name: Technology
capabilities.description: Likely requires the use of specialized software and technology for flood risk analysis and management.

skills.name: Flood Risk Analysis
skills.description: Analyzing flood processes and assessing risk to inform management plans.

skills.name: Stakeholder Engagement
skills.description: Building relationships with government and industry stakeholders for collaborative flood management efforts.

skills.name: Legislative Compliance
skills.description: Understanding and applying relevant legislation, policies, and guidelines in flood risk management.

generalRole.title: Senior Project Officer in Environmental Management
generalRole.description: This role involves advanced project management, problem-solving, and collaborative skills to develop and support the implementation of flood risk management programs, requiring a deep understanding of environmental science and engineering principles.
